title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Western, North-western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Galle and Matara districts today (25).

title: IMF urges Sri Lanka to promote investment, diversify exports amid tariff uncertainty
byline: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) says Sri Lanka must focus on diversifying its export markets and creating an investment-friendly environment to maintain stability and growth, even as recent tariff changes pose challenges to economic forecasting.

title: Another suspect arrested in Devinuwara double homicide
byline: Another suspect has been taken into custody in connection with the fatal shooting of two individuals near the southern gate of the Devinuwara Vishnu Devalaya, a crime that occurred on March 21, 2025.

title: Motorcyclist in Middeniya triple murder repatriated after arrest in India
byline: A suspect wanted in the recent triple murder at Middeniya, has been arrested in India and repatriated to Sri Lanka by officers of the Criminal Investigation Department (CID).

title: American rock band ‘Boyce Avenue’ arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: Globally renowned American rock band ‘Boyce Avenue’ arrived in Sri Lanka on the night of April 24 ahead of their much-anticipated concert in the country.

title: Indian Army retaliates after firing by Pakistan along LoC days after Pahalgam terror attack
byline: Firing was reported from multiple Pakistani posts along the Line of Control by the Pakistan Army throughout the night.

title: ‘Opposition frightened by the thought of becoming irrelevant’ - PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that the opposition is frightened by the possibility of losing its relevance, and that if one wishes to surpass the National People’s Power (NPP), they must demonstrate their commitment to ending corruption and fraud.

title: Second day of postal voting commences for 2025 LG Polls
byline: Today marks the second day of postal voting for the upcoming local government elections.

title: China tells Trump: If you want trade talks, cancel tariffs
byline: China has called on the US to cancel its sweeping tariffs on Chinese goods entering the country as a sign that the President Donald Trump is serious about resolving the trade war between the two countries.

title: Foreign Minister to attend Pope Francis’s funeral mass in Vatican
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism Vijitha Herath will represent the Government of Sri Lanka at the funeral of His Holiness Pope Francis, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced.

title: President makes surprise visit to Kandy, meets ‘Siri Dalada Wandanawa’ devotees
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake made an unannounced visit to Kandy yesterday (April 24) to meet with people queuing to participate in the ongoing ‘Siri Dalada Wandanawa’.

title: Sri Lankan state banks’ capital vulnerable despite profit gains: Fitch
byline: Fitch Ratings expects Sri Lanka’s state banks to continue to report weaker regulatory capital ratios than systemically important private banks, despite significantly higher profitability.

title: Police launch probe into officer’s verbal abuse of army officer on duty at ‘Siri Dalanda Vandanawa’
byline: Sri Lanka Police have launched an investigation on the instructions of the Acting Inspector General of Police (IGP) regarding the video clip circulating on social media showing a police officer verbally abusing an army officer on duty at the ongoing ‘Siri Dalanda Vandanawa’ in Kandy.

title: 28 injured in school bus accident at Mahiyanganaya
byline: A total of 28 individuals have been injured after a bus transporting schoolchildren was involved in an accident at the P.T.S. intersection in Mahiyanganaya.

title: Ex-President Ranil to appear before Bribery Commission on Monday
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe will appear before the Bribery Commission on Monday (28 April) over the statement he had made on MP Chamara Sampath Dassanayake, his lawyers have informed the Commission.

title: Sri Lanka and US agree to expedite bilateral trade agreement
byline: Sri Lanka and the United States have agreed to continue discussions aimed at finalizing a bilateral trade agreement between the two countries in the shortest possible time period.

title: ‘Siri Dalada Wandanawa’: Newly arriving devotees not allowed to join queues
byline: Sri Lanka Police have announced that newly arriving devotees will not be permitted to join the queues for the ‘Siri Dalada Wandanawa’ special exposition under any circumstances.

title: Apple to shift entire US iPhone assembly to India by 2026 amid trade war
byline: Apple plans to relocate the assembly of all iPhones destined for the United States to India as early as next year, as escalating US-China trade tensions prompt the tech giant to fast-track its supply chain diversification, the Financial Times reported, citing sources familiar with the matter.

title: President calls on Asgiri and Malwathu Chief Prelates to discuss ‘Siri Dalada Vandanawa’
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake visited the Chief Prelates of the Malwathu and Asgiri Chapters of the Siyam Nikaya today (25) and received their blessings, according to the President’s Media Division (PMD).

title: Detention orders issued against main suspect in Dan Priyasad murder
byline: The Colombo Magistrate Court has permitted the detention of the main suspect arrested in connection with the shooting and killing of social activist Dan Priyasad, for questioning until May 30, 2025.

title: Weather advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: Thundershowers accompanied by severe lightning are likely to occur at several places in Eastern, Uva, Central, Northern and North-central provinces and in Hambantota district, the Department of Meteorology warns.

title: Top LeT commander Altaf Lalli gunned down by Indian security forces
byline: A Lashkar-e-Taliba (LeT) associate, identified as Altaf Lalli, was eliminated by Indian security forces in an ongoing operation in Bandipora district, Jammu and Kashmir, officials confirmed on Friday.

title: Dollar climbs at end of wild week on signs of easing in US-China trade tensions
byline: The dollar headed for its first weekly gain since mid-March on Friday, after China granted some exemptions to U.S. imports, raising expectations that the trade war between the world’s two largest economies may be closer to abating.

title: 3 Sri Lankans abducted for ransom in Bangladesh, rescued by police
byline: Three Sri Lankan nationals, including a woman who was abducted for ransom in Bangladesh, were rescued by the police. According to local media reports, the trio had travelled to Bangladesh at the invitation of a friend they had met on social media.

title: Mobile phones and tablets worth Rs. 30M seized at BIA
byline: A stock of 228 brand-new mobile phones and tablet computers, valued at approximately Rs. 30 million in total, was seized by customs officers at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake today.

title: Acting IGP requested to appoint police team to assist investigation on Deshabandu
byline: The Acting IGP has been informed to nominate a police investigation team to assist the investigation of the Committee of Inquiry appointed to inquire and report its findings on IGP Deshabandhu Tennakoon in respect of acts of gross abuse of power.

title: President AKD condemns Pahalgam attack in phone call with Modi
byline: In a telephone conversation with Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi today (25), President Anura Kumara Dissanayake condemned the recent terrorist attack in the Pahalgam area of Kashmir and expressed solidarity with the Indian people, the PMD reported.

title: ‘Siri Dalada Vandanawa’ to conclude on Sunday as planned
byline: The “Siri Dalada Vandanawa,” the special exposition of the Sacred Tooth Relic, will conclude on Sunday (April 27) as previously scheduled and will not be extended, according to the Diyawadana Nilame of the Sri Dalada Maligawa, Pradeep Nilanga Dela Bandara.

title: IMF reaches staff-level agreement with Sri Lanka on fourth review
byline: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) staff and the Sri Lankan authorities have reached staff-level agreement on economic policies to conclude the Fourth Review of Sri Lanka’s reform program supported by the IMF’s Extended Fund Facility.

title: AG directed to file contempt charges against Deshabandu Tennakoon
byline: The Matara Magistrate’s Court has decided that IGP Deshabandu Tennakoon has committed contempt of court by bringing his vehicle inside the court premises on April 10, 2025.

title: Govt taking structured and strategic steps to curb organized drug trafficking – President
byline:
President Anura Kumara Disanayake stated that no nation in the world has achieved development by neglecting its cultural values and traditions. 

He emphasized that the current government is committed to rebuilding the country by reinstating the moral principles and ethical systems that have slowly diminished over the years.

title: Ex-US Rep. George Santos sentenced to over 7 years in prison for fraud and identity theft
byline: Disgraced former U.S. Rep. George Santos, who lied about his life story and defrauded donors, was sentenced Friday to over seven years in prison, sobbing as he heard his punishment.

title: EU’s GSP+ Monitoring Mission to visit Sri Lanka next week
byline: An European Union (EU) GSP+ Monitoring Mission will be visiting Sri Lanka from 28 April to 7 May 2025 to take stock of progress on the fulfilment of conditions linked to the granting of the Generalized Scheme of Preferences Plus (GSP+) trade preferences.
